questions.question: What HTTP method submits data to be processed?
questions.explanation: POST sends data to the server to create or update resources.

questions.question: What HTTP method updates an existing resource?
questions.explanation: PUT replaces the entire resource with the provided data.

questions.question: What HTTP method partially updates a resource?
questions.explanation: PATCH applies partial modifications to a resource.

questions.question: What HTTP method deletes a resource?
questions.explanation: DELETE removes the specified resource from the server.

questions.question: What secure alternative to FTP uses SSL/TLS?
questions.explanation: FTPS adds SSL/TLS encryption to standard FTP connections.

questions.question: What DNS record type maps domain names to IPv4 addresses?
questions.explanation: A records map hostnames to 32-bit IPv4 addresses.

questions.question: What DNS record type maps domain names to IPv6 addresses?
questions.explanation: AAAA records map hostnames to 128-bit IPv6 addresses.

questions.question: What DHCP message does a client send to discover servers?
questions.explanation: DHCPDISCOVER broadcasts to locate available DHCP servers.

questions.question: What DHCP message does a client send to request an IP address?
questions.explanation: DHCPREQUEST asks a specific server to assign an IP address.

questions.question: What protocol version adds encryption and authentication to SNMP?
questions.explanation: SNMPv3 adds security features including authentication and encryption.
